urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text: Same view a few weeks apart on the River Lugg. This is surely one one the most wanton acts of destruction we've seen in years. https://t.co/mI9zobAkU7 @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot https://t.co/b9K7li4Tvc

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@DavidPetts1 @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency People who have no respect for the environment and cause serious and irreparable environmental or archaeological damage to nationally identified important sites don‚Äôt deserve to own them, be custodians of them.

tweets.text: Same view a few weeks apart on the River Lugg. This is surely one one the most wanton acts of destruction we've seen in years. https://t.co/mI9zobAkU7 @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot https://t.co/b9K7li4Tvc

@RobGMacfarlane @DavidPetts1 @EnvAgency Land owners, like those who have damaged a section of the River Lugg and its bank, an SSI, do not appear to be fit, responsible land owners. There should be a law that anyone who deliberately wreaks such environmental damage should forfeit their land.

@KKAJ1234 @Mammoth_Spotter @DJ_Renney @inthesticks @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @EnvAgency @HfdsCouncil @HerefordshireWT Yes great interview from @HelenStace_HWT on BBC R4 Today programme https://t.co/HOtPxQfSDt
About 50 minutes in. Really laid it on the line.

tweets.text: @TheMontyDon Appalling especially as the River Lugg is such an important historical and archaeological artefact for #Herefordshire -  hope @HfdsCouncil @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA and @Jesse_Norman @BillWigginMP can ensure something is done

tweets.text: @RobGMacfarlane @DavidPetts1 @EnvAgency Land owners should be required by law, as far as possible, to reinstate trees, reinstate meanders in river.They should not gain, but lose big time, by their wanton environmental destruction.Other land owners need to learn that it does not pay to damage the environment or ecology.

When certain things happen, it's easy (and fair) to be angry with @EnvAgency but even @Feargal_Sharkey will agree coal-face EA staff, especially in Fisheries & Biodiversity teams are hard working, passionate people doing hard jobs. It's the backbone of the top brass that fail us

Incomprehensible this amount of work proceeded without the intervention of @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency To not deal with this robustly will be a mockery to the determined efforts by @WildlifeTrusts @theriverstrust @WildTroutTrust @SalmonTroutCons & others to protect our rivers https://t.co/S5bYnqGTJi

The owner of this land should be revealed publicly - anyone from Herefordshire know who did this?
https://t.co/cORmT9pQnS

@AleanKabut7 @EnvAgencyYNE @Bradford_TandA @WYFRS @EnvAgency If you want DM some contact information telephone number or email. I can report this to planning and our environmental health team for you.

Please be vigilant, our rivers need better than this harmful destruction of 1.5km of the beautiful Lugg. We sincerely hope the perpetrators are brought to account and immediate restoration is paid for. ‚Å¶@NE_WestMids‚Å© ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å©  https://t.co/aUVqvXx0G2

Despite being a designated SSSI, 1.5k of this beautiful Herefordshire river, and banks, have been bulldozed and straightened into a sterile canal. Bankside and riverside habitats have been completely obliterated. 

Repairing the damage will take decades.

https://t.co/xAiv8yES3n

At the end of this week @GroundworkCLM @DouglasPilot will be joining @EnvAgencyNW to take a look at the 2020 results of improving fish passage via @RibbleTrust @Mike_Forty #Adlington Partnership work in full flow #OURDouglas Camera at the ready! https://t.co/GO5xV5ptnn

urls.title: Beavers build first Exmoor dam in 400 years
urls.description: The National Trust says the dam in Somerset "might look modest, but it is incredibly special".

tweets.text:
The first beaver dam in over 400 years appeared on Exmoor after beavers were released into the wild in January.

These rodents can play an important role in engineering the landscape and helping to restore streams and reduce #flooding.

Learn more: https://t.co/h7VascPfWg
